Authors:
Shi-Ke Huang, Sajeewa Maharachchikumbura, Rajesh JEEWON,
Jayarama D. Bhat, Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Kevin D Hyde, Abdullah Mohammed
Al-Sadi, Ji-Chuan KANG
Title:
Lecanicillium subprimulinum (Cordycipitaceae, Hypocreales), a
novel species from Baoshan, Yunnan
Keywords:
asexual morph  hyphomycete  multi-gene phylogeny 
Sordariomycetes  taxonomy
Abstract:
In this paper, we report a new asexual-morph taxon
belonging to the family Cordycipitaceae (Hypocreales), which is
associated with a sexual morph of an ophioceras-like taxon on a
submerged wood collected from Baoshan, Yunnan, China. Morphologically,
this new taxon is similar to the asexual morph of Lecanicillium and
characterized by conidiophores arising from hyaline hyphae, with
gregarious, ellipsoid to ovoid, aseptate conidia. Phylogenetic analyses
of the combined LSU, SSU, tef1-α and ITS sequences data positions our
taxon within the Cordycipitaceae and close to Lecanicillium sp. (CBS
639.85) and L. primulinum. Lecanicillium subprimulinum is introduced
with molecular data to support its new species status in
Lecanicillium.
